TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content: Btw [@Gameslinx](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/144828-gameslinx/) have you tried starting the game in Dx11 as a workaround for now?

> 
> 
> 51 minutes ago, blackrack said:
> 
> 
> They are back with the new .dll? Or you just noticed them in a new situation you didn't check was fixed before?
> 

Those glitches are present in both DLLs. I just loaded a stock install and tried it out and at 109,000 meters, there's still some artifacts. This is a lot more noticeable on the planet mod i'm developing since the planet is smaller, so they are still there (though there has been an improvement compared to 0.52, it isn't completely gone)

I don't play in Dx11 but I can test that if you like

Small bug report: opening and closing the bay doors on the Mk2 Lander Can causes the game to shutter a lot (with ReStock is even worse, maybe beause it uses higher textures). I did a clean 1.6.1 install with only to Scatterer to test, should be easy to reproduce.

Just a fast question.

Should work in 1.5.1 but I can't guarantee it.

In the screenshot, you have stock [<abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/149733-14-13-122-environmentalvisualenhancements-140-1/), latest scatterer, and for the part shaders Textures Unlimited with some moduleManager patches for stock parts (can't remember where I grabbed it but probably this [https://spacedock.info/mod/1841/Textures Unlimited Default Stock Config - Unofficial](https://spacedock.info/mod/1841/Textures%20Unlimited%20Default%20Stock%20Config%20-%20Unofficial))  

The screenshot is taken at around sunrise.

Anti-aliasing set to 8x.

Screenshots was taken at 4K using F1 (button to take supersampled screenshot).

**Edited <time datetime="2019-03-17T11:28:39Z" title="03/17/2019 11:28  AM" data-short="5 yr">March 17, 2019</time> by blackrack**

Just an FYI that <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> installs 0.33x as the “latest version” for some bizarre reason. Likely a <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> issue but figured a heads up would be good in case people use <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> to install this and don’t realize they are using such a old version.

> 
>

Likely a <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> issue but figured a heads up would be good in case people use <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> to install this and don’t realize they are using such a old version.
> 

Hmm, I guess it's the lack of a trailing 0 in the new version number.

Uploading a new release.

Changelog:

    -Fix refraction/transparency artifacts in the ocean at altitude (swirly appearance)
    -Fix unnaturally bright scattering on the ocean and a small pop while transitioning to orbit
    -Fix white sky bug in some situations
    -Add trailing zero in version number for CKAN

Should be up in a few minutes

> 

8x ingame, no AA settings in scatterer. When I said that scatterer supports AA it means there is no longer aliasing when AA is active, in previous versions there was.

It works on dx9, dx11, OpenGL and GLcore.
